Text.Value: It'd be even better if we won, of course. But still.
And I'll take either one. Good to have you here.
Buy me a drink and we'll call it even.
Don't flatter yourself. I'm here for me.
Assuming something else doesn't kill me first.
Forget about the gold. You survived, that's all that matters.
Doesn't look like any of us are going to make it to Baldur's Gate.
Almost time for the killing to start again. Hooray.
See you in Baldur's Gate. Looking forward to that drink.
You know, that actually sounds pretty good.
Let's stick with gold. I hate to mix business and pleasure.
We survived. Who would've thought?
Or are you just keeping me alive to win that bet?
Only the long road to Baldur's Gate to worry about now. Let's hope our luck holds out.
It looks I might have to pay you after all. Once we get to the city, of course.
Oh, you charmer.
I'd tell you to stay safe out there, but after today, I doubt there's anything you can't handle.
You know, that actually sounds pretty good.
...I'd best see you there. I owe you a drink.

EditorData.NodeContext: Friendly, perhaps with a little wink (hinting at the drink you're gonna buy the player)

Text.Value: If you drink as well as you fight, we'll have a lot of fun.
Good. I'll be there to collect.
You know, whatever happens, I'm glad we've got you on our side.
They won't take the grove. Not while I can still hold a weapon.
Let's stick with gold. I hate to mix business and pleasure.
If you drink as well as you fight, we'll have a lot of fun.
Came back to join our heroic last stand?
I'm not forgetting that drink in Baldur's Gate. Dying doesn't get you off the hook.
Buy me a drink and we'll call it even.
With the goblins dead, we might actually make it to Baldur's Gate...

EditorData.NodeContext: Shock and hope piecing through your cynicism.

Text.Value: You're all right. Don't die, if you can avoid it.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're all right as in 'you're pretty cool'. Hint of flirtation

Text.Value: I can do both.
You didn't die. I didn't die. Seems we're destined for that drink.
May I never see this place again. Gods.

EditorData.NodeContext: You can't wait to get out of the den - you've had enough of the pain and bloodshed, but are hiding it with cynicism and an eye roll.

Text.Value: Should've taken that bet, my friend. I'd owe you big once we got to Baldur's Gate.
I'll see you in Baldur's Gate, then.
No no! A bet's a bet. I'll see you in Baldur's Gate.

Synopsis: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.
